newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE coffee futures lower as run-up fizzles-out.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE coffee futures lower as run-up fizzles-out.

text.p: London coffee futures stepped back further in light origin trade selling by Monday midesssion after last week's fund-led rally.
But volume at 1,238 lots was meagre and it comprised mainly crosses and nearby switches.
Benchmark July gapped $10 higher but soon headed south to break its immediate $1,750 support. It ended midesssion at $1,742, down $15, after a low of $1,732.
A stronger support is seen at $1,700. Technically, analysts said the market could attempt another assault on the highs at $1,820 on the longer-term.
Traders said activity was expected to remain thin in the coming days in view of a trade conference in Valencia, Spain, later this week and the approaching four-day weekend in some European countries.
Last week's activity was also curtailed by several holidays in Europe.
Trading volume in New York has also shrunk considerably in the past sessions as the market took a breather after the recent sharp volatility.
Fundamentally, traders in Indonesia said although local supply was ample, there were expectations that it would be running out by the third quarter of this year.
"The season this year is expected to be shorter than last year," said one. Indonesia is the world's top robusta coffe grower. -- Jalil Hamid, London newsroom +44 171 542 4985
